RT @PostOutlook: Sen. Joe Machin on how we should curb mass violence: http://t.co/UukIytO6
@smparrill Thank you very much, Steve. I appreciate it.
In memory of the 20 young children & 6 teachers who were killed, I'm committed to doing all I can to help make sure this never happens again
My hopes are that all parties would come to the table with goodwill.
I am pleased that the NRA is committed to making meaningful contributions to this conversation. That is a welcome perspective.
We can’t vilify each other before this debate. If we’ve gone from guilt by association to guilt by conversation, God help us as a nation.
As your Sen., I need to hear from experts on all sides about what is effective, how we can protect the 2nd Amendment & prevent mass violence
No single side can take action on their own – we need everyone to work together.
That means addressing military-style assault weapons & high-capacity rounds, treat our mentally ill & a culture that glorifies violence
As we discuss how to move forward after #Newtown, my position is that we need to put everything on the table.
I also applaud the suggestion from my friend @JoeLieberman for suggesting a commission on mass violence.
Everything needs to be on the table, and I ask all my colleagues to sit down to talk about firearms, mental health and our culture
This awful massacre has changed where we go from here. Our conversation should move beyond dialogue.
